intro: Corydalis mienningensis, commonly known as the Mienning corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in woodland or shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
